result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodoric G. McDonald

records.addlTxt:
9:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Theodoric G. McDonald in court, in custody.  Attorney David Rudolph Berman in court for Theodoric G. McDonald. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF413/22CF874/22CF875. Victim rights compliance. Attorney Berman is requesting an adjournment as he just received the State's final offer on 10/3/22 and he needs additional time to discuss the offer with the DE. The State does not object. Court adjourns.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant, Theodoric G. McDonald, appeared with Attorney David Rudolph Berman.  Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Mary S or April W.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

01:45 - 02:06 PM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney David Berman.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days;  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.. $1000  Cash bond continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). rb
DE in custody and appearing today at 1pm Intake.

BENCH WARRANT
KPD 22-013391
MUST POST OR HOLD FOR COURT

01:18 - 01:19 PM  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State w/ ADA Andrew Burgoyne.  Attorney David Berman appeared.  Clerk: PU.  No appearance by defendant. Warrant Authorized. Cash bond set at $1000.00  MUST POST OR HOLD FOR COURT  Prior bond forfeited.
Status conference on June 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Theodoric G. McDonald, appeared.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
SPD has not yet secured representation.  kmk

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Mary S or April W.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

02:22 PM    Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on April 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Warrant Vacated.  $2000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  ts
